title: Torque and work - work done by motor on turntable

content.question: A uniform disk is initially at rest at an angular position of zero. An electric motor rotates the disk by exerting a constant torque <math alttext="tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>τ</mi></math> on the disk. During the disk’s first and second complete revolutions, the motor does amounts of work <math alttext="W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> on the disk, respectively. The changes in angular speed of the disk during the first and second revolution are <math alttext="delta omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="delta omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="delta omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub 1 equals W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta omega sub 1 equals delta omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="W sub 1 equals W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta omega sub 1 is greater than delta omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="W sub 1 is less than W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta omega sub 1 equals delta omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="W sub 1 is less than W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta omega sub 1 is greater than delta omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="W sub 1 equals W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta omega sub 1 is greater than delta omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
